location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 432 of 1852 from Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary to the Government, Secret Department, Bombay to Captain Arnold Burrowes Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, at Bushire

mods.abstract: The letter — in response to a communication No. 11 from the Resident dated 26 October 1852 — is informing the Resident that Shaikh Sultan bin Suggur's [Sulṭān bin Saqr] remonstrance will be passed on to the the Court of Directors; the Shaikh is appealing against a ruling, which decided that compensation payments for violations of the Maritime Truce should be paid directly to injured parties, and not through their ruler.
